ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] ConcurrentModificationException's
ygData.msgSnippet: The below should be fixed as part of the recent commit of an updated DomainSensitiveFrontier (DSF adds filters midcrawl that stop further downloads from a host

The below should be fixed as part of the recent commit of an updated 
DomainSensitiveFrontier (DSF adds filters midcrawl that stop further 
downloads from a host whose document limit has been reached; the 
unsynchronized add of the filter is what was generating the CME).
St.Ack


Mike Schwartz wrote:

> hi,
>
> I'm running Heritirix 1.2, modified to include the RobegerFrontier code.
>
> In some of my crawls I see ConcurrentModificationException's in 
> runtime-errors.log, like the following:
>
> 20050227203200648    -5      36020 
> http://www.advertisewithdex.com/Dex/CDA/Products/Vertical_Detail_Page.jsp?pid=123&objType=Vertical&sid=1 
> <http://www.advertisewithdex.com/Dex/CDA/Products/Vertical_Detail_Page.jsp?pid=123&objType=Vertical&sid=1> 
> LRRRLL http://www.advertisewithdex.co
> <http://www.advertisewithdex.co/>m/Dex/CDA/Products/Browse_By_Business_Page.jsp 
> text/html #100 602 UCEGHVA4CATGRAL6RWEH2RKA273JFM7W -
>  java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
>         at 
> java.util.AbstractList$Itr.checkForComodification(AbstractList.java:449)
>         at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(AbstractList.java:420)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.settings.ComplexType$AttributeIterator.next(ComplexType.java:1034)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.filter.OrFilter.innerAccepts(OrFilter.java:95)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.Filter.accepts(Filter.java:93)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlScope.excludeAccepts(CrawlScope.java:316)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlScope.innerAccepts(CrawlScope.java:245)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.Filter.accepts(Filter.java:93)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.Postselector.schedule(Postselector.java:269)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.Postselector.handleLinkCollection(Postselector.java:358)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.Postselector.innerProcess(Postselector.java:184)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:102)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:255)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:131)
>
> Can anyone tell me why this is happening, and whether it has an impact 
> on the crawl (e.g., whether it might be causing me to miss crawling 
> some content, dupe crawl some content, etc.)?
>
> Thanks
>  - Mike Schwartz
